title.narrative: FLC: PSP / Poor People?s Parliament and Tribunal

description.narrative: Characteristically the poor in Zambia are socially economically and politically excluded and typically lack a voice to influence policies and processes. In order to catalyse poor people?s action engagement and participation in public service delivery of s ocial protection this project will create a forum to enhance poor people?s voice through the Poor Peoples Parliament and Tribunal (PPPT). The PPPT will bring together poor people in the 13 districts where the government?s Social Cash Transfer (SCT) is bein g implemented targeting directly 1500 beneficiaries. The PPPT process shall involve training of the SCT beneficiaries on relevant pieces of legislation and policies as well as social accountability tools. District parliaments will be held to formulate and debate motions. These local sittings will culminate in a national tribunal which will enable vulnerable people to give testimonies and provide evidence for effective interventions in the alleviation of extreme poverty in Zambia. The expected results are: 1 ) Increased citizen-driven accountability by government in implementation of SCT; 2) Strengthened engagement among vulnerable groups and decision makers (MPs) and the media resulting in bringing parliament and media closer to poor people; 3) Effective poor people?s action engagement and participation in decision making public service delivery and monitoring of pro-poor development programmes; 4) Citizens have the ability knowledge and motivation to claim their social protection entitlements and participate in social protection programmes. The district and national-level PPPTs will only take place once but local social accountability clubs will be formed and remain in place to keep providing data on the SCT programme delivery hence feeding into the channels o f official SCT grievance mechanisms. This project is a one-year pilot which ? if successful ? PSP Zambia would like to expand to other areas.
